001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import java.util.List;
004import java.util.Optional;
005import java.util.UUID;
006
007import org.immutables.value.Value;
008
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
010
011import io.github.ai4ci.Data;
012import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Abstraction.Entity;
013import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Abstraction.HistoricalStateProvider;
014import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
015import io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration;
016import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.StateMachine;
017import io.github.ai4ci.util.Ephemeral;
018import io.github.ai4ci.util.ThreadSafeArray;
019
020/**
021 * The central mutable container for an entire simulation instance.
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * An {@code Outbreak} holds all immutable or semi-immutable components of a
025 * single simulation run, including:
026 * <ul>
027 * <li>Configuration ({@link SetupConfiguration},
028 * {@link ExecutionConfiguration})</li>
029 * <li>Population of {@link Person} agents</li>
030 * <li>Social contact network ({@link SocialRelationship})</li>
031 * <li>Baseline parameters ({@link OutbreakBaseline})</li>
032 * <li>Current state ({@link OutbreakState}) and history
033 * ({@link OutbreakHistory})</li>
034 * <li>System-wide policy state machine ({@link StateMachine})</li>
035 * </ul>
036 *
037 * <p>
038 * This class is <b>mutable by design</b> to support efficient in-place updates
039 * during the simulation loop. However, all contained data (e.g., person states,
040 * config) are immutable or thread-safe, enabling safe parallel execution.
041 *
042 * <h2>Lifecycle</h2>
043 * <ol>
044 * <li><b>Setup</b>: Created via {@link #createOutbreakStub()}, then populated
045 * with people and social network by
046 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultNetworkSetup}</li>
047 * <li><b>Baselining</b>: Immutable baseline parameters (e.g., R₀-calibrated
048 * transmission) are computed once via
049 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultOutbreakBaseliner}</li>
050 * <li><b>Initialization</b>: Initial state (time=0) is set via
051 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultOutbreakInitialiser}</li>
052 * <li><b>Execution</b>: Updated daily by
053 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater}, which advances time,
054 * processes contacts/exposures, and updates states/history</li>
055 * </ol>
056 *
057 * <h2>Thread Safety</h2>
058 * <ul>
059 * <li>Reads from multiple threads are safe (e.g., during contact network
060 * traversal)</li>
061 * <li>Writes occur only during the sequential update cycle (one thread per
062 * simulation)</li>
063 * <li>Ephemeral fields ({@link #getNextState()}, {@link #getNextHistory()}) are
064 * used exclusively during the update cycle to stage next-day values</li>
065 * </ul>
066 */
067@Value.Modifiable
068@Data.Mutable
069public interface Outbreak
070                extends Entity, HistoricalStateProvider<OutbreakHistory>, Cloneable {
071
072        /**
073         * Factory method to create a minimal, unconfigured outbreak stub.
074         *
075         * <p>
076         * Used internally during simulation setup. Callers should use
077         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.ExecutionBuilder} instead.
078         *
079         * @return a new Outbreak instance with empty state/history and stubbed state
080         *         machine
081         */
082        public static ModifiableOutbreak createOutbreakStub() {
083                var tmp = new ModifiableOutbreak();
084                tmp.setNextHistory(Ephemeral.empty());
085                tmp.setNextState(Ephemeral.empty());
086                tmp.setStateMachine(StateMachine.stub());
087                return tmp;
088        }
089
090        /**
091         * underride equality to compare outbreak instances by their hash codes,
092         * which are random and unique per instance
093         *
094         * @param another the object to compare with this outbreak
095         * @return true if the other object is an Outbreak with the same hash code,
096         *         false otherwise
097         */
098        default boolean equality(Object another) {
099                if (another != null && another instanceof Outbreak)
100                        return this.hash() == ((Outbreak) another).hash();
101                return false;
102        }
103
104        /**
105         * Average network degree across all agents accounting for undirected edges.
106         *
107         * @return average degree
108         */
109        default double getAverageNetworkDegree() {
110                return this.getSocialNetwork().size() * 2
111                                / (double) this.getPopulationSize();
112        }
113
114        /**
115         * Calibrated baseline parameters computed once at simulation start.
116         *
117         * <p>
118         * Includes R₀-derived transmission probability, severity cutoffs, and
119         * infectivity profile. Never changes during simulation.
120         *
121         * @return outbreak baseline parameters
122         */
123        OutbreakBaseline getBaseline();
124
125        /**
126         * Returns the most recent historical state (same as current state during
127         * update cycle).
128         *
129         * @return an Optional containing the most recent OutbreakHistory, or empty
130         *         if history is empty
131         */
132        default Optional<OutbreakHistory> getCurrentHistory() {
133                return this.getHistory().stream().findFirst();
134        }
135
136        /**
137         * Current state of the outbreak at this simulation time.
138         *
139         * <p>
140         * Immutable snapshot containing prevalence, hospitalisations, mobility, and
141         * other aggregate metrics. Replaced entirely each timestep.
142         *
143         * @return current outbreak state
144         */
145        OutbreakState getCurrentState();
146
147        /**
148         * Configuration defining disease dynamics, behaviour, and policy.
149         *
150         * <p>
151         * Immutable after initialization. Includes in-host model, R₀, testing
152         * strategy, and policy triggers.
153         *
154         * @return execution configuration
155         */
156        ExecutionConfiguration getExecutionConfiguration();
157
158        /**
159         * Reverse-time-ordered list of historical outbreak states.
160         *
161         * <p>
162         * Most recent entry (index 0) corresponds to {@link #getCurrentState()}.
163         * Length is capped to ~2× infectious period to limit memory use.
164         *
165         * @return list of outbreak history entries, ordered from most recent to
166         *         oldest
167         */
168        @Override
169        List<OutbreakHistory> getHistory();
170
171        /**
172         * Ephemeral builder for the next day's outbreak history.
173         *
174         * <p>
175         * Only non-null during the update cycle. Used to accumulate daily summaries
176         * (e.g., test counts, incidence) before finalizing into
177         * {@link #getHistory()}.
178         *
179         * @return ephemeral builder for next outbreak history
180         */
181        Ephemeral<ImmutableOutbreakHistory.Builder> getNextHistory();
182
183        /**
184         * Ephemeral builder for the next day's outbreak state.
185         *
186         * <p>
187         * Only non-null during the update cycle (between {@code prepareUpdate()} and
188         * {@code switchState()}). Cleared after each timestep. Used to stage the
189         * next outbreak state before finalizing into {@link #getCurrentState()} and
190         * appending to {@link #getHistory()}.
191         *
192         * @return ephemeral builder for next outbreak state
193         */
194        Ephemeral<ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder> getNextState();
195
196        /**
197         * Thread-safe array of all agents in the simulation.
198         *
199         * <p>
200         * Size is fixed at setup time and equals {@link #getPopulationSize()}.
201         * Indexed by agent ID (0-based).
202         *
203         * @return thread-safe array of Person agents
204         */
205        ThreadSafeArray<Person> getPeople();
206
207        /**
208         * Retrieve a person by their ID.
209         *
210         * @param id the person's ID
211         * @return an Optional containing the Person if found, or empty if not found
212         */
213        default Optional<Person> getPersonById(int id) {
214                if (id >= this.getPeople().size()) return Optional.empty();
215                return Optional.ofNullable(this.getPeople().get(id));
216        }
217
218        /**
219         * Retrieves a specific agent's state at a given simulation time.
220         *
221         * @param id   agent ID
222         * @param time simulation day
223         * @return the agent's history record for that day, or
224         *         {@code Optional.empty()} if not found
225         */
226        default Optional<PersonHistory> getPersonHistoryByIdAndTime(
227                        int id, int time
228        ) {
229                return this.getPersonById(id).flatMap(p -> p.getHistoryEntry(time));
230        }
231
232        /**
233         * Total number of agents in the simulation.
234         *
235         * <p>
236         * Derived from {@code setupConfig.getNetwork().getNetworkSize()}.
237         *
238         * @return population size
239         */
240        default int getPopulationSize() {
241                return this.getSetupConfiguration().getNetwork().getNetworkSize();
242        }
243
244        /**
245         * Configuration defining population structure and contact network.
246         *
247         * <p>
248         * Immutable after setup. Includes demographic model (e.g., age-stratified)
249         * and network generator (e.g., Erdős–Rényi).
250         *
251         * @return setup configuration
252         */
253        SetupConfiguration getSetupConfiguration();
254
255        /**
256         * Social contact network as a thread-safe array of weighted edges.
257         *
258         * <p>
259         * Each {@link SocialRelationship} defines a potential contact between two
260         * agents, with strength modulated by demographics (e.g., age, proximity).
261         *
262         * @return thread-safe array of social relationships representing the contact
263         *         network this will have been finalised at setup time and will not
264         *         change during the simulation, but is thread-safe to allow
265         *         concurrent reads during contact processing
266         */
267        ThreadSafeArray<SocialRelationship> getSocialNetwork();
268
269        /**
270         * System-wide policy state machine.
271         *
272         * <p>
273         * Manages transitions between policy states (e.g., {@code MONITOR} ↔
274         * {@code LOCKDOWN} in {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.policy.ReactiveLockdown}).
275         *
276         * @return policy state machine
277         */
278        StateMachine getStateMachine();
279
280        /**
281         * Unique identifier for this simulation run.
282         *
283         * <p>
284         * Format: {@code urnBase:setupName:setupReplica:execName:execReplica}. Used
285         * for logging, output filenames, and random seed derivation.
286         *
287         * @return unique URN string
288         */
289        @Override
290        String getUrn();
291
292        /**
293         * underride hash code
294         *
295         * @return a random hash code for this outbreak instance
296         */
297        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
298        default int hash() {
299                return UUID.randomUUID().hashCode();
300        }
301
302        /**
303         * underride toString to return the outbreak's URN for easier identification
304         * in logs and outputs
305         *
306         * @return the URN of this outbreak instance
307         */
308        default String print() {
309                return this.getUrn();
310        }
311
312}
